critique:
The document aims to convey a sense of resolve and determination to address a serious threat. It seeks to evoke a sense of urgency and concern regarding the situation in the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (Serbia and Montenegro) and the Republic of Serbia. The primary emotions the President wants to elicit are fear (regarding the threat to national security and foreign policy), sadness (related to the human suffering), and a sense of hope that the actions taken will lead to a positive resolution. The document also conveys a sense of disgust at the actions and policies that are promoting ethnic conflict and human suffering. Surprise is less relevant here, as the document focuses on a deliberate and planned response to a known situation. The initial scores are based on this analysis.

Revised scores:
- Joy: 1 (not a primary emotion)
- Sadness: 7 (due to human suffering)
- Anger: 6 (at the actions and policies of the governments involved)
- Fear: 8 (regarding the threat to national security and foreign policy)
- Disgust: 7 (at the ethnic conflict and human suffering)
- Surprise: 2 (not a primary emotion)
